conclusion: The distance between two objects is determined by the difference in the areas under their velocity-time graphs.
The area under the velocity-time graph represents the displacement of the object.
The farther apart the two objects are, the greater the difference in the areas under their graphs.
From the graph, the area under the graph of object A is always greater than the area under the graph of object B.
Object A is always ahead of object B.
The difference in the areas under the graphs is greatest when the area under the graph of object A is the largest and the area under the graph of object B is the smallest.
The two objects are farthest apart at time t2.
